question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Name Field Overflow] At line 83, struct_tag.name is converted to String - can extremely long resource names (millions of characters) cause memory exhaustion or database column overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_delete_resource()] [Type Mismatch Attack] At line 69, can an attacker delete a resource using a different type string than was used to create it, causing the indexer to store incorrect type information for deleted resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_write_resource()] [Type String Length] Are there any length restrictions on the type_ field, and can unbounded Move type signatures with hundreds of nested generic parameters cause database performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Generic Type Bomb] At lines 84-93, generic_type_params are recursively serialized - can an attacker create circularly referenced or infinitely recursive generic types causing the indexer to hang or crash? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Type Parameter Overflow] When iterating over generic_type_params, is there a limit on the number of parameters, or can an attacker provide thousands of generic parameters causing excessive memory allocation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Error Propagation] At line 92, when conversion to JSON Value fails for any generic parameter, unwrap_or(None) returns None for the entire generic_type_params - does this lose all type information instead of just the failing parameter? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_write_resource()] [Generic Inconsistency] If generic_type_params conversion fails and returns None at line 51, but the type_ string at line 47 includes generic parameters, does this create inconsistent indexer state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Type Deserialization] When generic_type_params is stored as JSON and later retrieved, can malformed JSON cause deserialization errors in applications querying the indexer database? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_delete_resource()] [Deletion Without Write] Can an attacker trigger from_delete_resource() for a resource that was never written, creating a database entry with is_deleted=true but no prior write entry, breaking indexer invariants? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_write_resource()] [Double Write Attack] If the same resource is written twice in one transaction with different write_set_change_index values, does the indexer correctly store both entries or does one overwrite the other? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Struct: MoveResource] [Transaction Block Height Mismatch] Can transaction_block_height be inconsistent with the actual block height of the transaction, and does the indexer validate this relationship? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_write_resource()] [Data Null Inconsistency] If is_deleted is false at line 53, data must be Some(value) - but is this invariant enforced, or can bugs cause is_deleted=false with data=None creating invalid state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_delete_resource()] [Deleted Resource Query] When is_deleted=true, applications querying for active resources must filter this out - but is this filtering documented and enforced, or can apps incorrectly treat deleted resources as active? [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: convert_move_struct_tag()] [Name Parsing] Can struct_tag.name contain characters that are invalid in Move identifiers, and does the conversion validate this or allow malformed names into the database? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Function: from_write_resource()] [Parsed Data Reuse] At lines 42-51, parsed_data is cloned multiple times - is this efficient for large struct tags, and could deeply nested types cause excessive memory allocation during cloning? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Struct: MoveResource] [SQL Injection] The Diesel Insertable trait - when string fields (name, type_, address, module) are inserted, does Diesel properly parameterize queries or could malicious Move resource names inject SQL? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_resources.rs] [Struct: MoveResource] [Database Transaction Safety] Are MoveResource insertions part of a database transaction, and if a batch insertion fails midway, does the indexer roll back partial changes to maintain consistency? (High)
